title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: When attempting to change the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listing present. The expected behavior is to display the children node listing after changing the data source.
OB: No children node listing is displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: After changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing should be displayed.
SR:
1. Open the data set editor page in the query tab.
2. Create a new data set without any SQL statement.
3. Verify that the newly created data source does not contain any information about database, table, or column.
4. Attempt to change the data source for the data set.
5. Observe that there is no children node listing displayed.
6. Close the data set editor.
7. Reopen the data set editor.
8. Verify that after reopening, the children node listing is now displayed.
